title: Build a Semantic Page Structure
description:
Create a properly structured page using semantic HTML elements.

## Requirements

1. Create a `<header>` containing:
   - A `<nav>` element with navigation links
   - The nav should have an `aria-label="Main navigation"`

2. Create a `<main>` element containing:
   - An `<h1>` with the page title "Welcome to Our Site"
   - An `<article>` element with an `<h2>` heading

3. Create an `<aside>` element:
   - With an `<h2>` heading "Related Links"

4. Create a `<footer>` element:
   - With copyright text

## Expected Result

A semantically correct page structure that screen readers can navigate easily.
starterCode:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Semantic Page</title>
</head>
<body>
    <!-- Add your semantic structure here -->
    
</body>
</html>

testCases.description: Page should have a header element
Header should contain a nav element
Page should have a main element
Page should have an article element
Page should have an aside element

hints: Wrap the site navigation in <header><nav aria-label="Main navigation">...</nav></header>
Use <main> for the primary content area
There should be only one <h1> per page, inside <main>
Use <article> for self-contained content like blog posts
Use <aside> for secondary content like sidebars
